newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar weaker at close, trade minimal.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar weaker at close, trade minimal.

text.p: White sugar futures retained their earlier slight weakness in thin activity on Monday with a dearth of trading interest caused by the absence of the New York market.
The May/August spread attracted some dealing interest but almost all the day's turnover derived from trades on the spot May contract.
The market closed early at 1700 GMT to reflect the absence of the raws market due to President's Day. London white sugar volume amounted to just 464 lots.
May was down 80 cents at $303.80 and August down 70 cents at $303.90, maintaining the slight contango. Earlier, light selling was noted from Paris brokers using the London market, traders said.
Physical news was thin on the ground although details of Pakistan's recent white sugar purchases are slowly trickling out.
Thai trade sources said China bought 14,000 tonnes of Thai sugar for nearby shipment from Japanese trade house Mitsui. No details were available on price.
The vessel Jiang Chuan arrived at a Thai port for loading the sugar for shipment on February 15, they said.
No white sugar was tendered for delivery against the Matif March contract at close of business on Friday.
May was down 50 cents at $303.50 and August down 70 cents at $303.80. Matif volume totalled 247 lots.
